utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey. You work the lunch shift?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ve got eight pounds of salmon that’s about to go bad. Do you know how to cook it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Damn it. Should have liberated the iffy chicken. What are you and Professor Fussyface up to tonight?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Star Wars on Blu-ray.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Haven’t you seen that movie, like, a thousand times?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not on Blu-ray. Only twice on Blu-ray.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know, it’s high-resolution sadness.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’m going to take myself out to a movie tonight. You want to go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Do we do that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, we haven’t spent time alone together since we broke up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it’s not a date, Leonard. It’s just a man and a woman hanging out, and not having sex at the end of the night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sounds like most of my dates.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off, voice heard through apartment door as they approach)
utterance.content: Oh, dear Lord, get away from me, you monster!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is that about?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, he’s smart and crazy enough, he may have actually created a monster.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shoo, shoo! Be gone!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What the hell is going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s a bird outside the window, and he won’t go away. That is the hell that is going on. We have no worms or seeds here. Shoo, shoo.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? On top of everything else, you’re afraid of birds?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s called ornithophobia. And someday it will be recognized as a true disability, and the landlord will be required by law to put a giant net over the building. Which is unfortunate, because I have a fear of nets.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So movies, yes or no?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Movies, yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great. I’ll see you later. And remember, he’s more afraid of you than you are of him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That doesn’t help.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I was talking to the bird.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Go away, bird. Go away, bird. Go away, bird.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, just ignore him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good idea. Attention is what birds want. Oh, much better. All right. Now I’ll just get along with my life. Make a pot of tea, Leonard. It’s going to be a long night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The bird’s still there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Quick, what does a hawk sound like?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Scree-scree.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, that’s a seagull. If you’re not going to help, don’t help.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry. Do you think I’m overdressed?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It depends on the activity. For a prostate exam, yes. If you’re playing Vegas, I’d add sequins.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going to the movies with Penny. I don’t want her to think that I think it’s a date.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you think it’s a date?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, but she might think I think it’s a date even though I don’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or you might think she thinks you think it’s a date even though she doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are we overthinking this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not at all.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re right. I’m fine. I’m wearing this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? A blazer? All right. Yes, hello. This is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Yeah, I’m at 2311 North Robles Avenue. Yeah, I’d like to report a dangerous wild animal. A blue jay. I’m sorry, this is Animal Control. I don’t understand the laughter. No, the bird is not in my home. If he was in my home, I obviously would have called 911. Sir, I have no doubt that there are things that you’re frightened of. Being stuck in a dead-end public service job? Or your wife stepping out on you because you’re stuck in a dead-end public service job? Or spiders? Don’t you think I tried making cat noises?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (returning in a tee shirt and backwards cap)
utterance.content: Too casual?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For an audience with the queen, yes. For an evening of passing a bottle of fortified wine around a flaming trash can, you look great. What am I thinking? Whiskers!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey, if we hurry, we can make the new Jennifer Aniston movie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure. There’s also an amazing documentary about building a dam on river in South America.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, but the Jennifer Aniston movie has Jennifer Aniston, and she’s not building a dam.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can’t argue with that. I’ll get the tickets.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, you know what? I think it’s about time I pick a movie we see.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You pick plenty of movies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. You always picked, and it was always the same. An hour and a half of beach houses in the rain until the woman turns around and realizes love was here all along.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But come on, that is a great movie, and it starts in ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I hate those movies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, you don’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, I do. The only reason I went is because you wanted to see them, and I wanted to have sex. To this day, I can’t see a Sandra Bullock movie poster without getting both bored and aroused.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, so while we were going out, how often would you pretend to like things just to have sex with me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All the time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Does this sound familiar? I’d love to go shoe shopping with you. Hiking? It’s great. It’s two a.m., of course I want to go to Korea Town and sing karaoke with your friends. Who wouldn’t?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, we were going out. You were going to get sex anyway.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? You would have slept with me after a three-hour documentary on dams?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. No woman would.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See? Now, that’s the great thing. We’re out as friends. This is not a date. Sex is off the table. So, let’s go learn why hydroelectric power might not be the environmental bargain you think it is. Sorry. Spoiler alert.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks. Tickets are eleven bucks. Not a date.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon, Star Wars.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m pushing play.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A minute.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If we don’t start soon, George Lucas is going to change it again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This would go a lot faster if you put your trade school diploma to work and helped me set up this high frequency tone generator.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have a Masters degree from M.I.T.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but you’ve got a can-do attitude and that’s what’s important.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I really don’t get your problem with birds.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The question you should be asking is what is their problem with me? My first memory, a hummingbird dive-bombing my stroller to get at the apple juice in my sippy cup.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hummingbirds are pretty.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hummingbirds are the vampires of the flower world.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Still my first choice for an ankle tattoo. Or a dolphin, I go back and forth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Age seven, a blood-thirsty chicken chases me up a tree. Age twelve, a magpie tries to steal the retainer out of my mouth. Age sixteen, a parrot in a pet store called me fat ass. Need I go on?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, please. This is way better than the movie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, Sheldon, your bird death ray is ready.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not a death ray. It’s just a little ultrasonic blast to scare him off. Trust me, if I had a death ray, I wouldn’t be living here. I’d be in my lair enjoying the money the people of Earth gave me for not using my death ray. All right, and in three, two, one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That is one tough birdie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, you enjoyed the movie. I saw you tearing up when the village got flooded, and everyone had to relocate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I was thinking how come they get to leave and I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going to get some fries. You want anything?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, no, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you sure? Because you always say no, and then you eat half my fries.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I just eat the little crispy ones you don’t like.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I love them. I save them for the end, but they’re gone because you ate them. And why did I let you eat them?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: To get sex.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Exactly. But this is not a date. So I ask again, would you like anything?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, I’d like an order of fries.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. That’ll be five dollars. I am having the best time. I’m so glad you suggested we do this.

utterance.speaker: Penny (accidentally nudging the man sitting behind her)
utterance.content: Oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What you writing there?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: A screenplay. Its about a guy whose roommate is having sex and tells him go to a bar and work on his screenplay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I Hope Alex Gets Crabs: The Movie.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: It’s a working title.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: I’m Kevin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Penny. Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Kevin
utterance.content: I’ll let you get back to your date.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. This isn’t a date, no. Right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So have you written anything I might have seen?

utterance.speaker: Kevin
utterance.content: That depends. How much time do you spend on Yelp?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. I’m a grown man from Texas. This isn’t a terrifying bird like a swan or a goose. It’s just a blue jay. That’s a pretty big blue jay. One, two, three. Go! Shoo! Am-scray, ird-bay! Bird in the apartment! Bird in the apartment! No!

utterance.speaker: Penny (to Kevin)
utterance.content: So it is an amazing documentary. They need the electricity from the dam, but at the same time they want to preserve the environment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding me. Uh, can I see you for a sec over here?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Sure. Just one sec?

utterance.speaker: Kevin
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know what you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What am I doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re going out of your way to talk to that guy because I said we weren’t on a date.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I’m talking to him because he’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, he’s not that cute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, he is. With his dorky T-shirt and his little hipster glasses.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wear dorky T-shirts and glasses.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, but when you’re tall and have great cheekbones, you’re doing it ironically.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If that’s so, what if I start talking to a girl?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You should.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m serious. I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good! Go! There are some girls right over there. What are you waiting for?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’re in a group. I’m scared.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, what do you expect us to do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re biologists. Biology is the study of living things. That’s a living thing, get cracking.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I specialize in microorganisms, and Amy studies brains.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, neither of us minored in bird-shooing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, come now. Your undergraduate work must have included a varmints and critters class.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come back in, Sheldon, he’s not going to hurt you. He looks friendly. I think he might be someone’s pet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, Bernadette, don’t be a hero!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, he’s a sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. It’s very sweet. Now, slowly and carefully, flush him down the toilet.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, the only way to get past this fear is to interact with it. Just like you did with the mailman.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Every year tens of people around the world are killed by birds. I’m not going to be another statistic.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Look how sweet he is. Come over and say hi. Come on. You can do it. Don’t be scared. Come on. Oh, just pet the bird, you big baby!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I did it! I actually did it. Okay, now flush him.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: So, Leonard, what do you do for fun?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, let’s see. Hiking. Karaoke in Koreatown. Any Jennifer Aniston movie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. Sorry I ditched you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s fine. You can ditch away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. We said we were going to hang out, let’s hang out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s cool. Go back to Kevin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, he had to leave.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Interesting. So now that he’s gone, you want to hang out with me.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: This must be Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I totally get it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Huh? I’m sorry, get what?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it. You know, there’s some guys over there. You should go talk to them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no. I want to know what you told her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s kind of between me and…

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Laura.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Laura.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Okay, I see. So while he was telling you things, did he mention he owns not one, but two Star Trek uniforms?

utterance.speaker: Laura
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Wears them. Not just for Halloween.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, pal. You didn’t see me telling Kevin that you thought cold wars were only fought in winter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Then I’ll return the favour, and I won’t tell…

utterance.speaker: Laura
utterance.content: Laura.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Laura that half the dirty movies you own are animated.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When you were telling Kevin about your acting career, did you mention your long-running role as Waitress in a local production of The Cheesecake Factory?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did you tell her about your lucky asthma inhaler?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? Spell asthma.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: A… S… Take me home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe I’m not done hanging out with… You’re right, it’s getting late.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s remarkable. All that time spent in fear. And for what? He’s magnificent. Oh, dear. I just realized I haven’t offered you a beverage.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, it’s just like my grandma with her parrot. And after she lost her marbles with her remote control.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My phone’s on the desk over there. Take a picture of us together. Make it good enough to go on a mug, a mouse pad, and a calendar. If you were a dove, I’d call you Lovey-Dovey. Oh. Who am I kidding? This isn’t a moment for strict adherence to the literal. You’re just my little Lovey-Dovey, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Guess you gotta have hollow bones to get some sugar around here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I still think he looks like someone’s pet. Maybe we should put up posters.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. It should have a big picture of him, and the words, is this your bird? Not anymore. We’re going to have so much fun together. You can carry messages to all my enemies. I can tie a string to your leg and fly you like a kite.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If you’re keeping him, I’ve got a cage you can borrow. One of the test monkeys slipped on a banana peel and broke his neck. It was both tragic and hysterical.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nonsense. No. Lovey-Dovey doesn’t sleep in a cage. No. Lovey-Dovey sleeps in his very own nest, which I’m going to get off the windowsill and put in my room. Isn’t that right, LD? No. Where are you going? Come back, Lovey-Dovey! This is your home now! I already ordered 20 pounds of bird feed off of Amazon! He’s gone.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How could he do this to me? Get back here, you stupid bird, so I can love you!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. So, we went out, saw a movie, met some nice people, said horrible things about each other in public, all in all, a pretty magical night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m not innocent in all this, but you basically called me stupid, you asthmatic dumbass.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know, I, I, I crossed a line. And I’m sorry. No, no, no, hang on. I really mean it. And it’s not like when we were going out, I’d just apologize for everything so we could end up in bed. This is a 100% sex-is-off-the-table I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Thank you. I’m sorry, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just to be clear, sex is off the table, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Way off.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe we’re not ready to hang out as friends.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. Up until the last part, I was kind of enjoying take-charge Leonard with a little backbone. Picking the movie, knowing what he wants, a little cocky.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, then, I’m putting sex back on the table. What do you think about that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh. Maybe I like it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You do? Because if that’s what you like, I can be that guy. I swear, I’ll be anything you want me to be.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I am such an asthmatic dumbass. I had a weird night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mine was great. I’m going to be a mommy.
